title: Installation issue: picard
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

picard doesn't automagically allow you to use newer versions than coded in `package.py` because of the need to use `version(..., expand=False)`.  Therefore a manual version bump is needed for the latest version.

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install picard@2.24.0
...
==> Error: Unable to parse extension from https://github.com/broadinstitute/picard/releases/download/2.24.0/picard.jar.

If this URL is for a tarball but does not include the file extension
in the name, you can explicitly declare it with the following syntax:

    version('1.2.3', 'hash', extension='tar.gz')

If this URL is for a download like a .jar or .whl that does not need
to be expanded, or an uncompressed installation script, you can tell
Spack not to expand it with the following syntax:

    version('1.2.3', 'hash', expand=False)
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-940-88cafacd09
* **Python:** 3.7.3
* **Platform:** linux-pureos9-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original
```

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->

```console
$ spack maintainers picard
(no output) 
```

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] (can't build, so build log doesn't apply) I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
